intro: Tetrachyron discolor, commonly known as the variable four-leafed plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive four-leaf structure, which is a rare trait in the genus. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are usually a mix of green and white, contributing to its unique appearance. The flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family.
